alert.note: Alert for Smith (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued December 14 at 8:48AM CST until December 14 at 1:00PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM CST FOR NORTHWESTERN JASPER AND EAST CENTRAL SMITH COUNTIES... At 848 AM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Bay Springs, or 11 miles northwest of Stringer, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Bay Springs around 855 AM CST. Turnerville around 905 AM CST. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Sylvarena, Montrose and Louin. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
